results:
Based on the search results, I found information about a Polish doctoral dissertation on Bulgakov's "The Master and Margarita." Here are the key findings:

There is a doctoral dissertation titled "Mistrz i Małgorzata Michaiła Bułhakowa w Polsce w latach 1969-1989" (The Master and Margarita by Mikhail Bulgakov in Poland in the years 1969-1989) written by Karolina Korcz at the Adam Mickiewicz University in Poznań at the Faculty of Polish and Classical Philology. The dissertation was written under the supervision of prof. dr hab. Bogusław Bakuła and completed in Poznań in 2015.

The dissertation is available in the repository of Adam Mickiewicz University (AMUR) and can be accessed at the University Library at ul. F. Ratajczaka 38/40 in Poznań.

The research was also published as a book with the subtitle "Cień Wolanda nad PRL : obecność, recepcja, odzew" (The Shadow of Woland over the Polish People's Republic: presence, reception, response) by Wydawnictwo "Poznańskie Studia Polonistyczne" in 2016.

This doctoral work appears to focus specifically on the reception and presence of Bulgakov's masterpiece "The Master and Margarita" in Poland during the period 1969-1989, examining how this important Russian novel was received and influenced Polish literary and cultural discourse during the communist period.
